title: Projects
text:
Fall 2024

Watershed Sustainability - WR204
In the fall of 2024 I took a class on watershed science. The final project was a collaborative river reach assessment based on data released by the City of Fort Collins.
 Poudre River Reach Assessment 



Spring 2025

Quantitative Reasoning for Ecosystem Science- ESS 330
In the spring of 2025 I took a class on quantitative reasoning based in R. The course focused on applying instruction on coding in R to applications in statistics and data science.

Building a project website:

In this assignment I built a personal website with Github Pages.
Includes a github repo for access to all the code.
Began reformatting file management across my personal systems.
Involved extensive troubleshooting and became familiar with R and Terminal syntax.



Other Lab Projects
Lab 2: Minnesota Tree Growth - Examined forestry data from Minnesota to learn how to use the dplyr package. - Used functions like slice(), filter(), arrange(), select(), mutate(), rename() and summarize to manipulate these data.
Lab 3: COVID-19

Explored the New York Times COVID-19 data using r.
Used tidyverse and flextable packages to organize and display data.
Used the zoo package to calculate rolling averages.

Lab 4: LTER Statistics In R

Used R to explore data from the National Science Foundation Long Term Ecological Research Network.
Used r packages including tidyverse, ggpubr, car and visdat to conduct statistical tests and display the data in the lterdatasampler package.




Sustainability Science - ESS 312
In this course I will be completing a research project exploring impacts and perceptions of obstacles to sustainable transportation in and around the campus of CSU Fort Collins. Update expected April 2025.


Life Cycle Assessment for Sustainability - ESS 555
In this course I will be completing a comparative LCA. Update expected March 2025.

title: Zachary Cramton
text: Hello! I’m a student at Colorado State University with a passion for sustainable development, urban ecology and regional planning. I’m particularly focused on revitalizing abandonded infrastructure and incorporating sustainability through ecology into urban areas.
